summary: The Equitable Arts Education Enhancement Act directs the Secretary of Education to establish a grant program for minority-serving institutions (MSIs) to support arts education. The bill aims to increase access to arts education for minority students, promote diversity in the arts, and support programs that preserve and showcase artwork by minority artists. Grants can be used for various purposes, including student aid, outreach, mentorship, exhibitions, and professional development. The bill highlights the value of arts in society and the need for greater diversity and funding in arts programs.
